results.title: Islands in the sky
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and Dietmar Fill
results.brief_description: Shows the summer wildflowers in Kosciusko National Park. Discusses adaptation of the plants to the hostile environment and includes an alpine herb field, ferns and bogs.

results.title: Island target
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Ralph Smart
results.brief_description: The story of one squadron of Australian airmen in action against the Japanese in the islands north of Australia. The work of the squadron included the covering of Allied landings and a hazardous attack on Japanese headquarteres on one particular island.
results.description: The story of one squadron of Australian airmen in action against the Japanese in the islands north of Australia. The work of the squadron included the covering of Allied landings and a hazardous attack on Japanese headquarteres on one particular island.

results.title: Island people
results.creator_credit: Realist Film Unit (Great Britain), John Taylor and Philip Leacock
results.brief_description:
How Six People Spend Saturday: “It is Saturday in Britain, the day divided between work and rest. In the morning six people, representative of various types, are seen at work in the industrial areas, on the farms and in the cities. They are a craftsman from the Midlands, a typist in a big Manchester office, a tug captain on the River Thames, a farmer from the Lowlands of Scotland, a woman doctor from Cardiff and a small boy who lives in a suburb.
At midday the people crowd out of offices, factories and schools, all going home to prepare for the half-holiday.
Saturday afternoon is set aside for enjoyment. Out they go to their games and amusements, to play football and hockey, rugby and running, to work in the garden, to walk in the woods. At the end of the afternoon they go out to various places of amusement, or they return home to read and play or to make clothes or model aeroplanes.” (Source: Films of Britain - British Council Film Department Catalogue - 1940)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Realist Film Unit (Great Britain), John Taylor and Philip Leacock

results.title: Island of turtles
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Noel Monkman
results.brief_description: Turtles are found in the seas around the islands of the Great Barrier Reef, Queensland. Living most of its life in water the female turtle comes to land to lay her eggs in the sandy shores. After 9-10 weeks the eggs hatch out and the young turtles make their way to the sea. Also shows crested terns and other sea birds on the islands. Additional photography by C.P. Mountford.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Noel Monkman

results.title: Island of silence
results.brief_description: Due to raids and clan wars on Easter Island in the 18th and 19th centuries, the men descending from earlier generations died out. Huge sculptures whose origin and meaning are a mystery remain from an earlier strange civilization. Juxtaposes scenes of present day craftsmen and other islanders with the heroic vision depicted in the sculptures.

results.title: Island of dreams: a fable for our time
results.brief_description: An animated film showing a man going through the rat race called “earning a living” and fighting both people and traffic. At home there is no escape from noise and distraction; he dreams of an island paradise which in the end reveals its own problems.

results.title: Island observed
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Hector Lemieux
results.brief_description: A film record of M.E.T.E.I. (Medical Expedition to Easter Island), one of the most unusual scientific enquiries ever launched, headed by a McGill University research team. While the film is concerned mainly with the physical condition of Easter Islanders, it also provides glimpses of island activities, a village wedding, and the famous long-faced stone sculptures.

results.title: Island link
results.brief_description: In March of 1957, the cable linking Tasmania with the mainland was broken. This film shows the operations necessary to locate the break and raise, repair and re-lay the submarine cable in Bass Strait.
results.description: In March of 1957, the cable linking Tasmania with the mainland was broken. This film shows the operations necessary to locate the break and raise, repair and re-lay the submarine cable in Bass Strait.

results.title: Island fuse
results.brief_description: An experimental film in which the filmmakers are concerned with the experience of filming: the interaction between projected image, screen, camera, projector, light and filters. Old b&w documentary footage was reworked in colour, by refilming from a rear projector screen.

results.title: Island exile
results.brief_description: When a Nobel Peace Prize was awarded to the United Nations High Commission for Refugees the money was used to rehabilitate refugees in Greece, many of whom were skilled workers living a life of inactivity, misery and despair. With the arrival of a UN social worker, life for the refugees took on a new meaning. But, in many countries, the struggle for better conditions still goes on.
